4. "syndrome of inappropriate secretion of anti-diuretic hormone (SIADH)": This is a chemical condition, characterized by the inappropriate release of anti-diuretic hormone, leading to water retention and dilution of the sodium in the blood.
5. "sodium": This is a chemical element, specifically a metal that is essential for many biological processes.
6. "anti-diuretic hormone": This is a chemical substance, specifically a hormone that helps regulate water balance in the body.
